segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, focused entirely on the plate she's drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost comical how unaware she is of the water pouring over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle on the floor is widening, and she's standing right in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only imagine the chaos waiting to happen if she slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a familiar scene, yet nobody ever thinks it will happen to them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are up to no good, and she doesn't even see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that rickety stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout out, to stop him before he falls, but I hold back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is eagerly waiting, her outstretched hand full of expectation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a certain innocence in their mischief, but it’s still risky business.
segments.speaker: PAR
